statement:
The incomplete gamma function satisfies the following recurrence
formula:

$$\gamma (a+1,x) = a \gamma (a,x) - x^a e^{-x}$$

This can be derived by integration by parts:

$$\begin{aligned}
\int_0^x e^{-t} t^a \, dt &=&
- \int_0^x t^a \, d e^{-t} \\
&=& a \int_0^x t^{a-1} \, d e^{-t} - x^a e^{-x}\end{aligned}$$

In terms of other variants of the incomplete gamma function, the
recursion relation appears as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
P (a+1,x) &=& P (a,x) - {x^a e^{-x} \over \Gamma (a+1)} \\
\gamma^* (a-1,x) &=& x \gamma^* (a,x) + {e^{-x} \over \Gamma(a)} \\\end{aligned}$$
